The presence of influenza in semen has not been reported. However, the virus demonstrates extrapulmonary symptoms in many major organ systems, a large number of which have since been found contain to functional influenza receptors.
72
,
73 No studies to date have explored if those receptors are present in the human genital tract, but such tropism has been noted in turkeys.
74
,
75 Given the variability of viral tropism among animals, further work is need to explore whether such tropism exists among humans or is reflected by the presence of viral particles and RNA in semen.
